title.narrative: Towards sustainable reform: promoting freedom of religion or belief in Armenia

description.narrative: The intended project objectives are as follows: 1. To advance FoRB in Armenia through regular policy work, advocacy efforts and strengthening capacities of religious or belief organizations. 2. To address the issue of teaching religion in schools via research, policy dialogue with the MoESCS (Ministry of Education, Science, Culture and Sport), and building credible alternative options for opt-outs. 3. To contribute to the improvement of the quality and professionalism of media publications on issues of tolerance and diversity. The objectives set in the project were mostly met, some activities are not yet implemented and some actions need further work, more time and efforts to be achieved. However, with respect to certain activities, as a result of advocacy work, even better results are achieved than the project initially planned.

The project addresses the issues of freedom of religion or belief in the Republic of Armenia with a focus on the new draft law on Freedom of Conscience and Religious Organizations, violations of FoRB of children and parents in public education as well as enhancing the implementation of the soon to be adopted law on Equality. As a part of the project an informal forum for discussions will be established for religious or belief communities, several conferences tackling FoRB issues in Armenia and Georgia will be conducted; trainings and annual media award for journalists will be performed, journalists and media outlets will be further sensitized on the issues of FoRB. EPF will work with the Office of Human Rights Defender and Equality body on concrete cases of violations of FoRB in Armenia in order to create positive precedents and encourage others to use this mechanism for better human rights protection. Stronger networks of religious organizations will be supported which will jointly advocate for improvements of the law. In the sphere of education, EPF will explore options for opt-outs and communicate these to the school councils and religious communities.

The annual analytical narrative progress report of the project Towards sustainable reform: promoting freedom of religion or belief in Armenia covers the reporting period of June 1, 2019- May 31, 2020.
